articles.author: Tibi Puiu
articles.title: The Oldest Human Genomes in Europe Show How an Entire Branch of Humanity Disappeared - ZME Science
articles.description: An ancient human lineage roamed Europe's frozen tundra for nearly 80 generations. Then they died out.
articles.content:
An illustration depicts early Europeans who lived in what’s now Ranis, Germany, around 45,000 years ago. Credit: Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology.
